Package org.jtrim2.property.swing

Class SwingProperties

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.property.swing.SwingProperties
public final class SwingProperties extends Object
Contains static factory methods for conversion between Swing properties and properties of JTrim.

Warning: There is a notable difference between Swing and JTrim properties: Swing properties cannot be read from any thread. They usually only allowed to be read from the Event Dispatch Thread. This must be considered when using a property backed by a Swing property.

  • Method Details

    • fromSwingSource

      public static <ValueType, ListenerType> PropertySource<ValueType> fromSwingSource(SwingPropertySource<? extends ValueType,? super ListenerType> property, SwingForwarderFactory<? extends ListenerType> listenerForwarder)
      Returns a PropertySource backed by a Swing property. The returned property will completely rely on the specified SwingPropertySource. That is, when its value is read, it will request the SwingPropertySource to retrieve the value and it will rely on its change listener to be notified of changes in the value of the property.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for a SwingPropertySource. Therefore, you must always consider that the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource is called from an appropriate context (which is usually the Event Dispatch Thread in Swing).

      Type Parameters:
      ValueType - the type of the value of the returned property
      ListenerType - the type of the listener used by the Swing property to notify client code of the changes in the value of the property
      Parameters:
      property - the property backing the returned property. This argument cannot be null.
      listenerForwarder - the SwingForwarderFactory which creates a listener which might be registered with the backing property. The listener it creates must forward change notifications received from the SwingPropertySource to the Runnable passed to the SwingForwarderFactory. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the PropertySource backed by a Swing property. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • toSwingSource

      public static <ValueType, ListenerType> SwingPropertySource<ValueType,ListenerType> toSwingSource(PropertySource<? extends ValueType> property, EventDispatcher<? super ListenerType,Void> eventDispatcher)
      Returns a SwingPropertySource backed by a property of JTrim. That is, when its value is read, it will request the PropertySource to retrieve the value and it will rely on its change listener to be notified of changes in the value of the property.

      Note that the returned SwingPropertySource will inherit the thread-safety property of the specified PropertySource. That is, this means that the returned property can be accessed from any thread (unless, there are some implementation restrictions of the passed PropertySource).

      Type Parameters:
      ValueType - the type of the value of the returned property
      ListenerType - the type of the listener used by the Swing property to notify client code of the changes in the value of the property
      Parameters:
      property - the property backing the returned property. This argument cannot be null.
      eventDispatcher - the EventDispatcher forwarding value change events to the listener of the SwingPropertySource. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the SwingPropertySource backed by a property of JTrim. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • componentPropertySource

      public static <ValueType> PropertySource<ValueType> componentPropertySource(Component component, String propertyName, Class<ValueType> valueType)
      Defines a property which tracks a bound property of a java.awt.Component. Changes in the value of the property are expected to be detectable via a listener added with Component.addPropertyChangeListener. For example, the background property of a component is such property. Note however, that the "text" property of a JTextField is not.

      The specified component is expected to have getter method for the specified property. The getter method must follow the usual naming convention: Must not have any argument, must start with "get" followed by the property name whose first character is capitalized. For example, if the property is "background", then the component must have a getBackground() method.

      Note that this method does not support boolean properties whose getter methods start with the "is" prefix, only properties whose getter methods start with the "get" prefix.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for the returned PropertySource. Therefore, in general, you may only call the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource from the Event Dispatch Thread (as required in the majority of cases in Swing).

      Type Parameters:
      ValueType - the type of the value of the returned property
      Parameters:
      component - the component whose property is to be returned in the standard format. This argument cannot be null.
      propertyName - the name of the property as it can be specified for the PropertyChangeListener. This argument cannot be null.
      valueType - the type of the value of the property. The getter method must have a return type which can be cast to this type. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks a bound property of a java.awt.Component. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null
      IllegalArgumentException - throw if the specified property name is not valid because there is no appropriate getter method for it. This might be due to having a wrong return type or simply because the getter method does not exist.

    • documentText

      public static MutableProperty<String> documentText(Document document)
      Defines a property which is a view the value of the text property (getText) of the specified Document. That is, setting the text of the Document will be visible via the returned property. Note that, setting the value of the Document concurrently with the setValue method of the returned property is not allowed.

      Note that this method might be used with JTextComponent implementations as well (such as JTextField).

      Although the text property of Document is not required to be set on the Event Dispatch Thread, the listeners registered with the returned PropertySource will always be called on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Warning: You are not allowed to change the text property of the Document in the listeners. Adjusting the text property may or may not work and may even cause an unchecked exception to be thrown.

      Parameters:
      document - the Document whose text property is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which is a view the value of the text property of the specified Document. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified Document is null
      See Also:
      • textProperty(JTextComponent)

    • textProperty

      public static MutableProperty<String> textProperty(JTextComponent component)
      Defines a property which is a view the value of the text property (getText) of the specified JTextComponent. That is, setting the text of the JTextComponent will be visible via the returned property. Note that the returned property will also work if you change the Document of the JTextComponent.

      Although the text property of Document is not required to be set on the Event Dispatch Thread, the listeners registered with the returned PropertySource will always be called on the Event Dispatch Thread.

      Performance consideration: This property performs worse than the one returned by the documentText method. So, if you do not need to track changes of the document property, you should consider using documentText instead.

      Warning: You are not allowed to change the text property of the JTextComponent in the listeners. Adjusting the text property may or may not work and may even cause an unchecked exception to be thrown.

      Implementation warning: If you happen to add a change listener to the returned property on a thread other than the Event Dispatch Thread, there might be a small time frame until changes will actually be detected. Adding the listener on the Event Dispatch Thread does not have this flaw and will detect all changes to the text property after adding the listener.

      Parameters:
      component - the JTextComponent whose text property is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which is a view the value of the text property of the specified JTextComponent. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified component is null
      See Also:
      • documentText(Document)

    • buttonSelected

      public static MutableProperty<Boolean> buttonSelected(AbstractButton button)
      Defines a property which tracks the selected (isSelected()) property of an AbstractButton (including JCheckBox).

      The value of the property can never be null.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for the returned PropertySource. Therefore, in general, you may only call the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource from the Event Dispatch Thread (as required in the majority of cases in Swing).

      Parameters:
      button - the AbstractButton whose selected property is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks the selected (isSelected()) property of an AbstractButton. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified button is null

    • sliderValue

      public static MutableProperty<Integer> sliderValue(JSlider slider)
      Defines a property which tracks the value (getValue()) property of a JSlider.

      The value of the property can never be null.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for the returned PropertySource. Therefore, in general, you may only call the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource from the Event Dispatch Thread (as required in the majority of cases in Swing).

      Parameters:
      slider - the JSlider whose value property is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks the value (getValue()) property of an JSlider. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified button is null

    • spinnerValue

      public static MutableProperty<Object> spinnerValue(JSpinner spinner)
      Defines a property which tracks the value (getValue()) property of a JSpinner.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for the returned PropertySource. Therefore, in general, you may only call the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource from the Event Dispatch Thread (as required in the majority of cases in Swing).

      Parameters:
      spinner - the JSpinner whose value property is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks the value (getValue()) property of an JSpinner. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the specified button is null

    • comboBoxSelection

      public static <ValueType> MutableProperty<ValueType> comboBoxSelection(JComboBox<ValueType> comboBox)
      Defines a property which tracks the select item of a JComboBox. This property does not support JComboBox instances allowing multiple selections.

      Note: Attempting to set the value of the returned property to a value which cannot be found in the JComboBox will not change the selection of the JComboBox. The value of the returned property might also be null if no item is selected in the specified JComboBox.

      WARNING: Although PropertySource requires that the getValue() can be safely accessed from any thread, this is not true for the returned PropertySource. Therefore, in general, you may only call the getValue() method of the returned PropertySource from the Event Dispatch Thread (as required in the majority of cases in Swing).

      Type Parameters:
      ValueType - the type of the possible entries of the JComboBox
      Parameters:
      comboBox - the JComboBox whose selected item is to be tracked. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a property which tracks the selected item of an JSpinner. This method never returns null.
